title: Jeffrey Dean Morgan received matching tattoos with co-stars at wedding to Hilarie Burton
text:
Jeffrey Dean Morgan and his Supernatural co-stars Jensen Ackles and Jared Padalecki received matching tattoos at his recent wedding to Hilarie Burton.

The Seattle native, 53, shared a shot to Instagram Thursday in which he and the actors, who play his sons on the The CW series, had their arms inked by Brooklyn-based tattoo artist Mike Lucena at the October 5 nuptials in New York.

'Me and @hilarieburton weren't the only ones joined for life…. @jaredpadalecki @jensenackles and myself will forever have a bond that is both special, and permanent,' the actor wrote in a caption. 'Love you both dearly. #jmb #spnfamily @mikelucena73.'

The latest: Jeffrey Dean Morgan, 53, and his Supernatural co-stars Jared Padalecki, 37, (bottom, L) and Jensen Ackles, 41, and received matching tattoos at his recent wedding to Hilarie Burton

A rep for the actor, best known for his role as Negan on the AMC The Walking Dead, confirmed the marriage to People last week, which came amid reports the couple had wed in 2014. Morgan and the One Tree Hill actress, 37, initially began dating in 2009, and share son Augustus Morgan, nine, and daughter George Victoria Morgan, one.

Morgan plays the role of John Winchester on the show, the father of Dean (Ackles) and Sam (Padalecki).

Supernatural showrunner Misha Collins, with Ackles and Padalecki, said in March that they decided to end the series at a high point creatively.

Ackles, 41, said at the Television Critics Association summer press tour that the Winchester family could be revived in another project down the line, according to E! News.

Hugs all around: Morgan plays the role of John Winchester on the show, the father of Sam (Padalecki) and Dean (Ackles)

Sentimental: Morgan, who returned for the show's 300th episode last year, said he and his co-stars 'will forever have a bond that is both special, and permanent'

'I think they'll continue to move forward, but this is just a long journey that I don't think is ever going to be over,' he said. 'I think we're just going to go away for a while. How long? I don't know.'

Supernatural is set to begin its final season after 15 seasons, beginning in 2005. Morgan was a cast regular in its initial two seasons, coming back last year for the show's 300th episode.

Supernatural airs Thursday on The CW at 8/7c, while The Walking Dead airs Sunday at 9/8c on AMC.
